name: v2 Alternate Character Sets
description: FHIR Value set/code system definition for HL7 v2 table 0211 ( Alternate Character Sets)

property.description: The date at which a concept was deprecated. Concepts that are deprecated but not inactive can still be used, but their use is discouraged

designation.value: De leesbare tekens uit de ISO 8859/1 tekenset

extension.valueString: (This is the default if this field is omitted)

concept.display: The printable 7-bit ASCII character set.

designation.value: De leesbare 7-bit ASCII tekenset.

extension.valueString:
Does not need an escape sequence.

BIG-5 does not need an escape sequence. ASCII is a 7 bit character set, which means that the top bit of the byte is "0". The parser knows that when the top bit of the byte is "0", the character set is ASCII. When it is

concept.display: Code for Taiwanese Character Set (BIG-5)

designation.value: Code voor Taiwanese tekenset (BIG-5)

extension.valueString: Does not need an escape sequence.

concept.display: Code for Taiwanese Character Set (CNS 11643-1992)

designation.value: Code voor Taiwanese tekenset (CNS 11643-1992)

extension.valueString: Does not need an escape sequence.

concept.display: Code for Chinese Character Set (GB 18030-2000)

designation.value: Code voor Chinese tekenset (GB 18030-2000)

extension.valueString: Note that the code contains a space, i.e., "ISO IR14".

concept.display: Code for Information Exchange (one byte)(JIS X 0201-1976).

designation.value: Code voor informatieuitwisseling (één byte)(JIS X 0201-1976).

extension.valueString: Note that the code contains a space, i.e., "ISO IR159".

concept.display: Code of the supplementary Japanese Graphic Character set for information interchange (JIS X 0212-1990).

designation.value: Code voor het aanvullende Japanse ideogramschrift voor informatieuitwisseling (JIS X 0212-1990).

concept.display: ASCII graphic character set consisting of 94 characters.

designation.value: ASCII ideogramtekenset bestaande uit 94 tekens.

extension.valueString:
Note that the code contains a space, i.e., "ISO IR87".

The JIS X 0208 needs an escape sequence. In Japan, the escape technique is ISO 2022. From basic ASCII, escape sequence "escape" $ B (in HEX, 1B 24 42) lets the parser know that following bytes shoul

concept.display: Code for the Japanese Graphic Character set for information interchange (JIS X 0208-1990),

designation.value: Code voor de Japanse ideogramschrift voor informatieuitwisseling (JIS X 0208-1990).

concept.display: A subset of ISO2020 used for most Kanjii transmissions

designation.value: Een subset van ISO 2020 meestal gebruikt voor Kanjii verzendingen

concept.display: ISO 2022 with escape sequences for Kanjii

designation.value: ISO 2022 met escape-sequenties voor Kanjii

concept.display: Code for Korean Character Set (KS X 1001)

designation.value: Code voor Koreaanse tekenset (KS X 1001)

extension.valueString: Deprecated. Retained for backward compatibility only as v 2.5. Replaced by specific Unicode encoding codes.

concept.display: The world wide character standard from ISO/IEC 10646-1-1993

designation.value: De wereldwijde tekensetstandaard van ISO/IEC 10646-1-1993

extension.valueString: UTF-16 is identical to ISO/IEC 10646 UCS-2. Note that the code contains a space before UTF but not before and after the hyphen.

concept.display: UCS Transformation Format, 16-bit form

designation.value: UCS Transformatieformaat, 16-bits vorm

extension.valueString: UTF-32 is defined by Unicode Technical Report #19, and is an officially recognized encoding as of Unicode Version 3.1. UTF-32 is a proper subset of ISO/IEC 10646 UCS-4. Note that the code contains a space before UTF but not before and after the hyphen.

concept.display: UCS Transformation Format, 32-bit form

designation.value: UCS Transformatieformaat, 32-bits vorm

extension.valueString: UTF-8 is a variable-length encoding, each code value is represented by 1,2 or 3 bytes, depending on the code value. 7 bit ASCII is a proper subset of UTF-8. Note that the code contains a space before UTF but not before and after the hyphen. Since UTF-8 re

concept.display: UCS Transformation Format, 8-bit form

designation.value: UCS Transformatieformaat, 8-bits vorm
